content.description:
Stand start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand on the arete. From there, make a few easy moves by bumping the right hand up the arete and the left hand up to a perfect sidepull, at that point, paste a high foot, hit the sloping lip, then work the left hand through some poorly angled intermediate edges to reach a great edge and top it out.

This one gets tougher the higher you climb.
content.protection: A pad or two should do it, the landing is very good though.
content.location: This ascends the west-facing slab of Potato Rock.

content.description:
The Frozen Arts ascends a beautiful, slightly overhanging face on perfect edges. This is probably one of my favorites in this area!

Stand start with a left hand undercling and a right hand sidepull (the start is semi-awkward). From there, stick a left hand three finger edge, follow to a great right hand edge (crux?), then hit the sloping lip (crux?), work the feet up, and hit the big shelf a few feet behind the lip, and top it out.

The initial right hand sidepull is solid, but the upper part of the flake may not hold. Please try to avoid pulling on it from the top.
content.protection: A pad or two, the landing is sloping (in a good way) and clear.
content.location: It ascends the south face of Potato Rock.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand on the large undercling.  From there, work the hands up the edges while working a left toe hook.  At that point, make a deadpoint to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads, as the landing has a tree off to the side.
content.location: This ascends the southwest arete of Potato Rock.
